alert.note: Alert for Colquitt (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Colquitt County through 900 PM EDT... At 814 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of heavy showers over Moultrie, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Moultrie, Norman Park, Riverside, Schley, Sigsbee, Crosland, New Elm and South Moultrie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This cell may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
